data.event: Scranton was founded in 1908 around the New Bullion Mine, a lead and zinc mine.
It was part of the North Tintic Mining District, organized in 1902 for the area's silver, lead, and zinc mines.
The large pocket of good ore at the New Bullion lasted only about two years, and the town began to dwindle.
Then in October 1914 a new company called the South Scranton was organized, and miners dug a long tunnel in search of other mineral resources.
